name: Introduction to Deep Learning
desc: This lecture introduces the structure of the Deep Learning course, and gives a short overview of the history and motivation of Deep Learning.

name: Introduction to PyTorch
desc: This tutorial introduces the practical sessions, the TA organizer team, etc. Afterwards, we will discuss the PyTorch machine learning framework, and introduce you to the basic concepts of Tensors, computation graphs and GPU computation. We will continue with a small hands-on tutorial of building your own, first neural network in PyTorch.

name: Modular Learning
desc: This lectures introduces basic concepts for Deep Feedforward Networks such linear and nonlinear modules, gradient-based learning and the backpropagation algorithm.

name: Deep Learning Optimizations I
desc: This lecture series discusses advanced optimizers, initialization, normalization and hyperparameter tuning.

name: Activation Functions
desc:
In this tutorial, we will discuss the role of activation functions in a neural network, and take a closer look at the optimization issues a poorly designed activation function can have.

After the presentation, there will by a TA session for Q&A for assignment 1, lecture content and more.

name: Deep Learning Optimizations II
desc: This lecture series discusses advanced optimizers, initialization, normalization and hyperparameter tuning.

name: Convolutional Neural Networks
desc: This lecture series covers convolutional neural networks for image processing.

documents.name: Convolutional neural networks for image processing.

recordings.name: Convolutional neural networks for image processing.

name: Optimization and Initialization
desc:
In this tutorial, we will discuss the importance of proper parameter initialization in deep neural networks, and how we can find a suitable one for our network. In addition, we will review the optimizers SGD and Adam, and compare them on complex loss surfaces.

After the presentation, there will by a TA session for Q&A for assignment 1, lecture content and more.

name: Modern ConvNets
desc: This lecture series covers modern ConvNet architecture.

name: Transformers
desc: This lecture series covers Transformers

name: Inception, ResNet and DenseNet
desc:
In this tutorial, we will implement three popular, modern ConvNet architectures: GoogleNet, ResNet, and DenseNet. We will compare them on the CIFAR10 dataset, and discuss the advantages that made them popular and successful across many tasks.

After the presentation, there will by a TA session for Q&A for assignment 2, lecture content and more.

name: Graphical Neural Networks
desc: Lecture on Graph Neural Networks.

name: Generative Modelling: GANs and diffusion models
desc: TBA.

name: Transformers and Multi-Head Attention
desc:
In this tutorial, we will discuss the relatively new breakthrough architecture: Transformers. We will start from the basics of attention and multi-head attention, and build our own Transformer. We will perform experiments on sequence-to-sequence tasks and set anomaly detection.

After the presentation, there will by a TA session for Q&A for assignment 3, lecture content and more.

documents.name: Recording - Part 1 (What is Attention + MH Attention)

name: Deep Variational Inference
desc: TBA

name: Neural modelling of 3D
desc: TBA

name: Graph Neural Networks
desc:
In this tutorial, we will discuss the implementation of Graph Neural Networks. In the first part of the tutorial, we will implement the GCN and GAT layer ourselves. In the second part, we use PyTorch Geometric to look at node-level, edge-level and graph-level tasks.

After the presentation, there will by a TA session for Q&A for assignment 2, lecture content and more.

name: Self-Supervised and Causal Representation Learning
desc: We will discuss Tutorial 17: Self-Supervised Learning, and have a short introduction to Causal Representation Learning.
